text:
The #GlassFire has charred and devastated Wine Country.

Chronicle photographer 
@JaChristian

name: sfchronicle
text:
The out-of-control #GlassFire blackened 46,600 acres as of Tuesday night, burning the green trees and golden grass wedged between the blackened scars left by the 2017 Wine Country fires. Eighty homes were destroyed.

Read more >> https://t.co/B7em94484t

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @joegarofoli: "You might liken it to a pair of ids in a flood, squirming as worms to the top of a pile of mud that can fit only one of them, leaving the other, and the rest of us, drowning." @sfchronicle theater critic @LilyJaniak reviews #PresidentialDebate as theater https://t.co/ETFTAqvjEu

name: sfchronicle
text:
Less than 48 hours after a Bay Area couple put the finishing touches on a three-year home remodeling in the Napa Valley foothills, the #GlassFire reduced it to ashes. 

Destroyed along with the home were several collector’s vehicles. https://t.co/o9hOHM9vMI https://t.co/GgyWbDYI72

name: sfchronicle
text: Three days after the #GlassFire first erupted in Napa’s eastern hillsides, it was starting to become clear that the fire’s effects on the valley’s wine industry were nothing short of catastrophic. https://t.co/Jr2LarCgvl

 - 2% contained
 - 80,000 people evacuated
 - 80 homes destroyed
 - several wineries damaged or destroyed
 - 1,500 firefighters on scene
